ARABIC: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Even a whole army of Confederates will be routed there!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will be one more army vanquished among the many routed hordes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is only a small army out of the several armies that will suffer defeat here.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They are only a small band among the defeated confederate tribes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: This is just one of the disgraced armies, that will be routed there and then.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will be a defeated host like the Confederates of the old times.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A host of deserters of the allies shall be here put to flight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: A very host of parties is routed there!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: this host too, among other hosts, is bound to suffer defeat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Here there is a host of the confederates only to be defeated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [They are but] a host routed out there of the factions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But there - will be put to flight even a host of confederates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (As they denied Allah's Message) they will be a defeated host like the confederates of the old times (who were defeated).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The army is defeated as (were) the confederates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: An army of confederates with be defeated there.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:11]   A routed (mahzūmun is an adjectival qualification of jundun, ‘host’) host [is all that they are], in other words, they are [nothing but] a despicable host, nothing more — in their denial of you — from among the factions (mina’l-ahzābi, also an adjectival qualification of jundun) in other words, [they are] like those hosts of factions who were in confederation against prophets before you: these were defeated and destroyed, and likewise We shall destroy these [people].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A defeated) and slain (host are (all) the factions) of disbelievers: the disbelievers of Mecca (that are there) they were defeated and killed on the Day of Badr when they intended to kill the Prophet (pbuh).
